issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When using template-url with an HTTPS endpoint the operation fails. I first saw this using the raw display of a github file a tthe domain raw.githubusercontent.com and verified the same behavior with a file from an S3 bucket. The java keystore on the CLC has the certs the URLs are signed with.

euca2ools output
{code}
[root@a-25 ~]# euform-create-stack --template-url https://s3.amazonaws.com/cf-templates-113floyzgzmzs-us-east-1/2014202olf-buckets.json bucketstack
euform-create-stack: error (ValidationError): sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target
{code}

cloud-output.log stack
{code}

fields.summary: CloudFormation: template-url cannot consume HTTPS resources

comments.body:
Currently the euca.p12 is used as a trust store for HTTPS connections, we should use the default JDK trust store and allow users to configure the SSL settings:

{code}
# euca-describe-properties -v bootstrap.webservices.ssl.user
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.ssl.user_ssl_ciphers	RSA:DSS:ECDSA:+RC4:+3DES:TLS_EMPTY_RENEGOTIATION_INFO_SCSV:!NULL:!EXPORT:!EXPORT1024:!MD5:!DES
DESCRIPTION	bootstrap.webservices.ssl.user_ssl_ciphers	SSL ciphers for external use.
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.ssl.user_ssl_default_cas	true
DESCRIPTION	bootstrap.webservices.ssl.user_ssl_default_cas	Use default CAs with SSL for external use.
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.ssl.user_ssl_protocols	SSLv2Hello,TLSv1,TLSv1.1,TLSv1.2
DESCRIPTION	bootstrap.webservices.ssl.user_ssl_protocols	SSL protocols for external use.
{code}

So "user_ssl_default_cas" would enable/disable use of the default trust store and the other options would configure SSL ciphers/protocols. When the default trust store was in use the administrator would use OS facilities to manage trust (on CentOS/RHEL the JDK uses the trust store in /etc/pki/java/cacerts, which can be a link to /etc/pki/ca-trust/extracted/java/cacerts, see "update-ca-trust enable")

We may also want to add an option to disable hostname checking for HTTPS connections.

Changeset (without hostname checking option):
https://github.com/sjones4/eucalyptus/commit/883ea4aa9c9f424c7b3e
[~sjones]  Adding an option to disable HTTPS connections, and generally about HTTPS connections, should this be a cloud-wide setting, or something for CloudFormation?
[~ethomas], I believe the existing cloudformation settings allow you to control access to hosts and whether HTTP/HTTPS can be used for template access. Not sure I understood the question.

[~sjones], sorry I didn't clarify my meaning better.  You are proposing above an option to disable hostname checking for HTTPS connections.  This is most likely a verification override.  Are you proposing this option system-wide, or just for the Cloudformation service?
[~ethomas], I am proposing a cloud property to enable/disable hostname checking along with the other HTTPS settings. These cloud properties would initially only be used by cloudformation.

[~sjones]I think I understand better from the code, using these properties requires using SSLSetup, which customizes the HTTPS parameters and does not make them the default system-wide.  Having said that, would we ever want a situation where Cloudformation disables hostname verification but some other service does not?  I don't know of any other services that use outgoing HTTPS off the top of my head, though there may possibly be some.
[~ethomas], potentially every use of HTTPS could have distinct configuration requirements but I think it is best to start out simple and add further controls as necessary.

We now use OS settings to determine trust for HTTPS connections by default.

Protocols, ciphers, default CA use, and hostname verification are configurable using cloud properties:

{code}
# euca-describe-properties bootstrap.webservices.ssl.user
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.ssl.user_ssl_ciphers	RSA:DSS:ECDSA:+RC4:+3DES:TLS_EMPTY_RENEGOTIATION_INFO_SCSV:!NULL:!EXPORT:!EXPORT1024:!MD5:!DES
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.ssl.user_ssl_default_cas	false
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.ssl.user_ssl_enable_hostname_verification	true
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.ssl.user_ssl_protocols	SSLv2Hello,TLSv1,TLSv1.1,TLSv1.2
{code}

[~viglesias]/[~tony]:

Verified that this issue is fixed.

*Steps*

# Applied following IAM access policy to user:
{code}
# euare-grouplistpolicies -g Testers -v --region admin-hspencer@group1
cfn-euca10212
{
  "Statement": [
    {
      "Sid": "Stmt1419100012568",
      "Action": [
        "cloudformation:CreateStack",
        "cloudformation:DeleteStack",
        "cloudformation:DescribeStackEvents",
        "cloudformation:DescribeStackResource",
        "cloudformation:DescribeStackResources",
        "cloudformation:DescribeStacks",
        "cloudformation:ListStacks",
        "cloudformation:ListStackResources"
      ],
      "Effect": "Allow",
      "Resource": "*"
    },
    {
      "Sid": "Stmt1419100232791",
      "Action": [
        "ec2:AuthorizeSecurityGroupEgress",
        "ec2:AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress",
        "ec2:CreateSecurityGroup",
        "ec2:DeleteSecurityGroup",
        "ec2:DescribeInstanceStatus",
        "ec2:DescribeInstances",
        "ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups",
        "ec2:GetConsoleOutput",
        "ec2:RevokeSecurityGroupEgress",
        "ec2:RevokeSecurityGroupIngress",
        "ec2:RunInstances",
        "ec2:TerminateInstances"
      ],
      "Effect": "Allow",
      "Resource": "*"
    }
  ]
}
{code}
# Uploaded cloudformation template to S3 bucket, with public-read canned ACL
{code}
$ aws s3api put-object --bucket euca10212 --key cfn-euca10212-template.json --body cfn-euca10212-template.json --acl public-read --profile harold-work
$ aws s3 ls s3://euca10212 --profile harold-work
2014-12-20 13:17:47       2096 cfn-euca10212-template.json
{code}
# Tested 'public-read' ACL
{code}
# wget https://s3.amazonaws.com/euca10212/cfn-euca10212-template.json
--2014-12-20 10:21:46--  https://s3.amazonaws.com/euca10212/cfn-euca10212-template.json
Resolving s3.amazonaws.com... 54.231.244.8
Connecting to s3.amazonaws.com|54.231.244.8|:443... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK
Length: 2096 (2.0K) [binary/octet-stream]
Saving to: “cfn-euca10212-template.json”

100%[============================================================================================================================>] 2,096       --.-K/s   in 0s

2014-12-20 10:21:47 (5.23 MB/s) - “cfn-euca10212-template.json” saved [2096/2096]
{code}
# Created Cloudformation stack using '--template-url' option:
{code}
# euform-create-stack --template-url https://s3.amazonaws.com/euca10212/cfn-euca10212-template.json --parameter "UbuntuImageId=emi-c883ed00;UserKeyPair=tessai" DockerStack --region tessai-group1@group1
arn:aws:cloudformation::617513010345:stack/DockerStack/ea2e9449-0492-47c1-96d3-da91130df7e2
{code}
